b9f9ea46b8a9cc8b9d1154ba6f4a45352593132d|2009-09-23|evaleev@0fb12191-db4b-0410-8866-e78deaee71e5|1) Introduced MolecularEnergy::purge() method which can be used to get rid of data that suvives a call to obsolete(), e.g. SCF::obsolete() does not obsolete the vector so that it can be used as a guess for the next geometry. Some situations call for purge(), e.g. when orthog method changed vector would have to be projected, which is not implemented. 2) purge() allows to get rid of the hacky SCF::need_vec_, which kept track of whether initial_vector() has been called once or twice in the same compute() (only mattered when always_use_guess_wavefunction was set to true). Now there is no longer need for it and SCF::initial_vector() is much cleaner and easier to understand.

b23a9fc981f53892a87e477c3970c4068861f762|2005-08-09|jpkenny@0fb12191-db4b-0410-8866-e78deaee71e5|increased io precision whem writing to keyval streams
f6e1cb1b018d0d32b3788762a465dd5646b37b0c|2005-08-05|cljanss@0fb12191-db4b-0410-8866-e78deaee71e5|Fixes SourceForge Tracker item 1250405.  The radii used for the Becke weights changed from the bragg radii to the maxprob radii. atominfo.kv is missing the maxprob radii for many atoms, which caused a divide by zero and a SIGFPE for atoms such as Fe.  Now, if the maxprob radius is missing, the code will fall back to the Bragg radius.  NB: Better accuracy would probably be obtained if the maxprob radius were available for all atoms in the system.
